IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To support the mission of Dallas Theological Seminary by offering charitable planned giving and other related services to friends of the Seminary.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To support the mission of Dallas Theological Seminary by offering charitable planned giving and other related services to friends of the Seminary.
IRS990.Desc: Provided administration of funds given primarily for the support of Dallas Theological Seminary and ministries served by its alumni. These include donor advised funds making grants to Dallas Theological Seminary and ministries served by its alumni, charitable trusts, gift annuities, scholarships and designated grants.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: Amounts held on behalf of others

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Endowment funds intended uses (Part V, line 4)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowments are primarily used to provide scholarship funds to students at Dallas Theological Seminary and to support educational programs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other revenues not included on Form 990 (Part XI, line 2d)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Other revenue is change in value of split-interest agreements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other revenues included on Form 990 (Part XI, line 4b)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Investment fees were netted against revenue on the audited financials, and reported as expense on the 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other expenses included on Form 990 (Part XII, line 4b)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Investment fees were netted against revenue on the audited financials, and reported as expense on the 990.
Part V: Dallas Seminary Foundation is reporting the consolidated endowment with Dallas Theological Seminary.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Hear of IL Youth for Christ

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The foundation holds several donor advised funds. When a recommendation is received, confirmation of tax-exempt status of the donor organization is attained, and research is also performed to determine the mission and doctrinal position (if applicable) of the organization to ensure it does not conflict with the purpose of Dallas Seminary Foundation.
Certain individuals receiving compensation are ministers of the gospel, and as such, a housing allowance is included in Nontaxable benefits for some of the people listed in Pt. VII.
Dallas Seminary Foundation uses a realtor to sell donated real estate, when applicable.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Member election for additional members Part VI line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Dallas Theological Seminary Trustees must approve the appointment of all Dallas Seminary Foundation Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing body decisions Part VI line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Dallas Theological Seminary (DTS) has control over the decisions Dallas Seminary Foundation (DSF) makes. The Foundation Executive Director reports directly to the DTS Sr. Vice President for Advancement, who in turn, reports directly to the President of DTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 governing body review Part VI line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is initially reviewed by the organizations independent audit firm. The audit committee and governing board are given the public disclosure copy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Conflict of interest policy compliance Part VI line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires all officers and board members to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The Treasurer is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring that interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CEO executive director top management comp Part VI line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Boards compensation committee reviews and make recommendations of salary levels for the Executive Director and key employees. Comparable salary survey data is used. These decisions are documented in the committee meeting minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other officer or key employee compensation Part VI line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officers who are not employees are not compensated. The Boards compensation committee reviews and makes recommendations of salary levels for the President of Dallas Theological Seminary and key employees. Comparable salary survey data is used. These decisions are documented in the committee meeting minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing documents etc available to public Part VI line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents, conflict of interest policies and audited financial statements are available to the public upon request. Audited consolidated financial statements of Dallas Theological Seminary and Dallas Seminary Foundation are also on the Dallas Theological Seminary business office website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Explanation of other changes in net assets or fund balances Part XI line 9
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Change in value of split-interest agreements

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Estimate of average hours per week devoted to related organizations Part VII Col B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Certain directors, officers, and key employees of Dallas Seminary Foundation are also directors, officers, and key employees of our related organization, Dallas Theological Seminary. The hours reflected here reflect time spent for both organizations.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V response or note to any other line in Part V
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Staff are compensated by a related organization, Dallas Theological Seminary. Dallas Theological Seminary files all required payroll information returns as required by the IRS. As such, due to common paymaster rules as instructed by the IRS, the number of employees reported represent the number of employees who work for the filing organization but are compensated by a related organization.
Dallas Seminary Foundation reimburses Dallas Theological Seminary for Dallas Seminary Foundation officer salaries and other employee salaries.
